justification: The methods section states that "parameter λ [captures] loss aversion" within the prospect-theory model used to analyse the two-alternative forced-choice data.

measured_by: Proportion of riskier choices in mean-preserving lottery pairs
justification: The authors note that "the proportion of riskier options chosen in this kind of lottery pair … can be used to track their relative attitudes towards gains and losses," describing it as a behavioral measure of loss aversion.
The value function is defined with exponent α, and the text explains that "parameter α [captures] the decision maker's sensitivity to outcomes."
Choice probabilities are modeled with a sigmoid function where "θ ≥ 0 corresponds to the choice sensitivity of the logistic choice rule," making θ the metric for this construct.
